20110103060210.000|20110103060210.000|CC1|NATURE, PASTOR DOUG.            
20110103060210.000|20110103060215.000|CC1|YOU'LL HEAR WHAT THEY SAY LATER,
20110103060215.000|20110103060216.000|CC1|OF COURSE, THE WHISPERING,

20110103060217.000|20110103060218.000|CC1|CAME WITH THE DISCOVERY.

20110103060220.000|20110103060224.000|CC1|WHO HE APPEARED TO BE, DOUG

20110103060226.000|20110103060228.000|CC1|OF HIGMAN.

20110103060230.000|20110103060232.000|CC1|GOD-GIVEN TAL THAENT TURNED DOUG

20110103060243.000|20110103060245.000|CC1|LATER, THREE KIDS, SWIMMING POOL
20110103060245.000|20110103060247.000|CC1|BUSINESS AND WIDELY ADMIRED     
20110103060247.000|20110103060248.000|CC1|WRESTLING COACH.                
20110103060248.000|20110103060251.000|CC1|BUT THEN HE WAS 35 AT THE TIME. 
20110103060251.000|20110103060253.000|CC1|IT WAS THE MID '80s.

20110103060315.000|20110103060317.000|CC1|CHRIST WAS RESURRECTED FROM THE 
20110103060317.000|20110103060319.000|CC1|GRAVE ON THAT DAY.

20110103060324.000|20110103060326.000|CC1|AFTER A FEW YEARS, PEOPLE WERE  
20110103060326.000|20110103060328.000|CC1|DRIVING IN FROM TOWNS MILES AWAY
20110103060328.000|20110103060331.000|CC1|TO HEAR DOUG'S UNIQUE PREACHING

20110103060433.000|20110103060436.000|CC1|IT WAS HIS BOUNDLESS ENTHUSIASM 
20110103060436.000|20110103060439.000|CC1|THAT ATTRACTED FRANK CRAIG.     
20110103060439.000|20110103060441.000|CC1|COULDN'T HAVE BEEN THE RELIGION.
20110103060441.000|20110103060444.000|CC1|ASK HIS OWN RELATIVES.          
20110103060444.000|20110103060446.000|CC1|>> HE WAS AN ECCENTRIC

20110103060454.000|20110103060455.000|CC1|>> FOUL MOUTH?                  
20110103060455.000|20110103060456.000|CC1|>> OH, YES, HE SWORE.

20110103060502.000|20110103060504.000|CC1|HAD NO TROUBLE MAKING ROOM FOR  
20110103060504.000|20110103060505.000|CC1|HIS UNBELIEF.

20110103060507.000|20110103060510.000|CC1|VISIT AT THE OLD MAN'S FARM AND 
20110103060510.000|20110103060511.000|CC1|EVERY TIME THEY DROPPED BY,     
20110103060511.000|20110103060515.000|CC1|THERE WOULD BE ANOTHER TREASURE 
20110103060515.000|20110103060517.000|CC1|THEY WOULD HAVE TO ADMIRE.

20110103060517.000|20110103060518.000|CC1|MOST PEOPLE WOULD USE.          
20110103060518.000|20110103060520.000|CC1|>> THERE WAS NEVER A PIECE OF   
20110103060520.000|20110103060524.000|CC1|JUNK THAT WAS WORTH THROWING OUT
20110103060524.000|20110103060525.000|CC1|IN FRANK'S MIND.                
20110103060525.000|20110103060527.000|CC1|THE COMMUNITY HAD AN OLD --     
20110103060527.000|20110103060529.000|CC1|FRANK SAID, NO, TOW IT OVER TO  
20110103060529.000|20110103060530.000|CC1|MY PLACE.                       
20110103060530.000|20110103060533.000|CC1|HE HAD A PILE OF BOLTS, MACHINE 
20110103060533.000|20110103060534.000|CC1|BOLTS, METAL BOLTS AND THE PILE 
20110103060534.000|20110103060538.000|CC1|WAS ABOUT 12-FOOT TALL AND ABOUT
20110103060538.000|20110103060539.000|CC1|10 FOOT ACROSS.                 
20110103060539.000|20110103060541.000|CC1|>> EVERY YEAR, THAT PILE GREW.  
20110103060541.000|20110103060543.000|CC1|OLD STUFF FILLED UP FRANK'S     
20110103060543.000|20110103060545.000|CC1|LIVING ROOM, KITCHEN AND        
20110103060545.000|20110103060545.000|CC1|BEDROOM.                        
20110103060545.000|20110103060546.000|CC1|THERE WERE GADGETS AND CLOCKS

20110103060549.000|20110103060550.000|CC1|FURNITURE AND TRACTORS AND      
20110103060550.000|20110103060551.000|CC1|TRUCKS SPILLED OUT ON TO THE    
20110103060551.000|20110103060554.000|CC1|BACKYARD AND SPREAD AND GREW AND
20110103060554.000|20110103060556.000|CC1|RUSTED ALL THROUGH THE 17 ACRES 
20110103060556.000|20110103060557.000|CC1|OF FRANK'S FARM.                
20110103060557.000|20110103060558.000|CC1|>> YOU COULD BARELY WALK THROUGH
20110103060558.000|20110103060601.000|CC1|THE HOUSE, BECAUSE THERE WERE SO
20110103060601.000|20110103060603.000|CC1|MANY THINGS OR TREASURES, AS HE

20110103060604.000|20110103060606.000|CC1|>> MICHELLE HAD KIND OF ADOPTED

20110103060609.000|20110103060610.000|CC1|>> THERE WAS A BEAUTIFUL OLD

20110103060616.000|20110103060618.000|CC1|THAT I COULD PURCHASE FROM HIM, 
20110103060618.000|20110103060620.000|CC1|AND HE SAID NO, THAT THAT WAS   
20110103060620.000|20110103060622.000|CC1|GOING TO GO IN A MUSEUM SOME

20110103060622.000|20110103060624.000|CC1|AND THAT'S WHEN I FIRST HEARD   
20110103060624.000|20110103060626.000|CC1|ABOUT THE MUSEUM.               
20110103060626.000|20110103060630.000|CC1|>> SO, THAT'S WHY HE SAVED ALL  
20110103060630.000|20110103060632.000|CC1|THE JUNK -- TREASURES.          
20110103060632.000|20110103060634.000|CC1|HE HAD BEEN DREAMING ABOUT THAT 
20110103060634.000|20110103060635.000|CC1|MUSEUM HIS WHOLE LIFE, A PLACE  
20110103060635.000|20110103060639.000|CC1|WHERE KIDS COULD LEARN WHAT FARM
20110103060639.000|20110103060640.000|CC1|LIFE WAS LIKE BACK WHEN FRANK   
20110103060640.000|20110103060641.000|CC1|WAS A BOY.                      
20110103060641.000|20110103060643.000|CC1|SO, IF HE WAS A TIGHTWAD, HE HAD
20110103060643.000|20110103060643.000|CC1|TO BE.                          
20110103060643.000|20110103060645.000|CC1|WASN'T HE SAVING UP FOR A

20110103060645.000|20110103060647.000|CC1|>> HE HAD TALKED FOR YEARS AND

20110103060650.000|20110103060652.000|CC1|BUT THEY DIDN'T THINK IT WAS

20110103060654.000|20110103060655.000|CC1|ABOUT UNTIL AFTER ROY'S DEATH.  
20110103060655.000|20110103060657.000|CC1|>> ROY, THAT WOULD BE ONE OF    
20110103060657.000|20110103060659.000|CC1|FRANK'S BROTHERS WHO DIED IN    
20110103060659.000|20110103060701.000|CC1|1998 AND LEFT EVERYTHING HE HAD 
20110103060701.000|20110103060701.000|CC1|TO FRANK.                       
20110103060701.000|20110103060705.000|CC1|SO, NOW HE HAD A COOL $2.5      
20110103060705.000|20110103060706.000|CC1|MILLION.                        
20110103060706.000|20110103060706.000|CC1|>> PLUS WHATEVER AMOUNT OF MONEY
20110103060706.000|20110103060708.000|CC1|HE HAD IN COFFEE CANS AROUND THE
20110103060708.000|20110103060708.000|CC1|HOUSE.                          
20110103060708.000|20110103060712.000|CC1|>> HOW RICH WAS HE?             
20110103060712.000|20110103060714.000|CC1|BUD WHITNEY SAID HE BOASTED ONCE
20110103060714.000|20110103060716.000|CC1|THAT HE WAS WORTH $5 MILLION,   
20110103060716.000|20110103060718.000|CC1|ENOUGH TO MAKE GOOD ON THAT     
20110103060718.000|20110103060720.000|CC1|DREAM TO BUILD THAT MUSEUM.     
20110103060720.000|20110103060723.000|CC1|OF COURSE, THINGS ARE NEVER     
20110103060723.000|20110103060725.000|CC1|REALLY THAT EASY, ARE THEY?     
20110103060725.000|20110103060726.000|CC1|FRANK HAD LOTS OF MONEY NOW AND 
20110103060726.000|20110103060727.000|CC1|HAD PLENTY OF OLD STUFF LYING   
20110103060727.000|20110103060728.000|CC1|ALL OVER THE PLACE, BUT HE WAS  
20110103060728.000|20110103060729.000|CC1|80 YEARS OLD.                   
20110103060729.000|20110103060733.000|CC1|DIDN'T HAVE THE FAINTEST IDEA   
20110103060733.000|20110103060734.000|CC1|HOW TO DEVELOP A MUSEUM.        
20110103060734.000|20110103060735.000|CC1|ONE THAT PEOPLE MIGHT ACTUALLY  
20110103060735.000|20110103060736.000|CC1|WANT TO COME AND SEE.           
20110103060736.000|20110103060738.000|CC1|FRIENDS TOLD HIM HE WOULD HAVE  
20110103060738.000|20110103060742.000|CC1|TO HIRE A BIG-CITY ATTORNEY OR  
20110103060742.000|20110103060742.000|CC1|SHOULD SET UP A NONPROFIT       
20110103060742.000|20110103060743.000|CC1|CORPORATION.                    
20110103060743.000|20110103060744.000|CC1|AND FRANK DID NOT WANT TO SPEND 
20110103060744.000|20110103060748.000|CC1|HIS MONEY ON THAT SORT OF THING.
20110103060748.000|20110103060755.000|CC1|INSTEAD, HE SUCKED UP HIS       
20110103060755.000|20110103060755.000|CC1|PROFANITY-LACED DISBELIEF AND   
20110103060755.000|20110103060756.000|CC1|WENT TO CALL ON THAT WELL-KNOWN 
20110103060756.000|20110103060757.000|CC1|OPTIMIST, THE LOCAL PASTOR.     
20110103060757.000|20110103060759.000|CC1|THAT'S HOW DOUG PORTER GOT MIXED
20110103060759.000|20110103060802.000|CC1|UP WITH THE ONE MAN WHOSE SOUL  
20110103060802.000|20110103060803.000|CC1|HE COULDN'T SAVE.               
20110103060803.000|20110103060805.000|CC1|DIDN'T HAVE A CLUE HOW TO PLAN  
20110103060805.000|20110103060807.000|CC1|OR BUILD A MUSEUM EITHER, WHICH 
20110103060807.000|20110103060810.000|CC1|IS WHY HE CALLED STACEY CARLSON,
20110103060810.000|20110103060811.000|CC1|LOCAL REAL ESTATE WHIZ.         
20110103060811.000|20110103060814.000|CC1|>> I WOULD HAVE TO HAVE, WOULD  
20110103060814.000|20110103060817.000|CC1|YOU HELP ME DO THIS BECAUSE I   
20110103060817.000|20110103060818.000|CC1|DON'T HAVE THE REAL ESTATE      
20110103060818.000|20110103060819.000|CC1|KNOWLEDGE OR THE DEVELOPMENT    
20110103060819.000|20110103060819.000|CC1|KNOWLEDGE, ANY TYPE OF THING.   
20110103060819.000|20110103060822.000|CC1|>> STACEY SET UP A MEETING AT   
20110103060822.000|20110103060824.000|CC1|WHICH FRANK TOLD HER ALL ABOUT  
20110103060824.000|20110103060825.000|CC1|HIS DREAM OF AN IDEA.           
20110103060825.000|20110103060826.000|CC1|>> HE HAD A VISION OF A PLACE   
20110103060826.000|20110103060829.000|CC1|WHERE FAMILIES COULD COME, WHERE
20110103060829.000|20110103060831.000|CC1|THE SCHOOLS COULD BRING YOUNG   
20110103060831.000|20110103060836.000|CC1|CHILDREN ON A FIELD TRIP.       
20110103060836.000|20110103060838.000|CC1|BASICALLY, HE SAYS, I DON'T WANT
20110103060838.000|20110103060838.000|CC1|KIDS TO THINK THAT MILK COMES

20110103064624.000|20110103064626.000|CC1|ALL LANDED IN DOUG PORTER'S

20110103064629.000|20110103064629.000|CC1|CHILDREN.                       
20110103064629.000|20110103064631.000|CC1|>> BUT, OF COURSE, FRANK HAD    
20110103064631.000|20110103064632.000|CC1|GIVEN PASTOR DOUG POWER OF      
20110103064632.000|20110103064633.000|CC1|ATTORNEY.                       
20110103064633.000|20110103064635.000|CC1|THUS, THE RIGHT TO SET UP THE   
20110103064635.000|20110103064636.000|CC1|ACCOUNTS AND RECEIVE THE MONTHLY
20110103064636.000|20110103064638.000|CC1|CHECKS FROM FRANK'S RETIREMENT  
20110103064638.000|20110103064639.000|CC1|ACCOUNTS.                       
20110103064639.000|20110103064640.000|CC1|STILL, WHAT WAS HE DOING WITH   
20110103064640.000|20110103064642.000|CC1|THAT MONEY?                     
20110103064642.000|20110103064645.000|CC1|>> WHAT HE WOULD ALWAYS DO, HE  
20110103064645.000|20110103064646.000|CC1|WOULD DEPOSIT IT LESS CASH.

20110103064647.000|20110103064650.000|CC1|CHECK AND HE TAKES OUT $1,000   
20110103064650.000|20110103064651.000|CC1|CASH.

20110103064652.000|20110103064654.000|CC1|JUNE 4th, HE DEPOSITS A CHECK,  
20110103064654.000|20110103064656.000|CC1|TAKES OUT $200 CASH.            
20110103064656.000|20110103064701.000|CC1|JUNE 6th, DEPOSITS A CHECK,

20110103064703.000|20110103064706.000|CC1|JUNE 24, MAKES A DEPOSIT, TAKES 
20110103064706.000|20110103064707.000|CC1|$3,000 CASH.                    
20110103064707.000|20110103064710.000|CC1|>> DOUG TOOK MORE THAN $13,000  
20110103064710.000|20110103064712.000|CC1|IN CASH FROM FRANK'S RETIREMENT
